moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. Nc3: I wasn't expecting that, will just continue as usual
moves.2... e6 3. a3: I think this is a little defensive
moves.3... Be7 4. e3: Well the black bishop is locked in
moves.4... O-O 5. Be2 d5: I am looking to expand on the queen side and c5 is coming
moves.6. Bg4: I will continue with developing my pieces
moves.6... c5 7. dxc5 Bxc5 8. Bf3: The bishop has now moved 3 times ??
moves.8... Nc6 9. Nge2: it is all square but black has a little bit more space
moves.9... a6 10. O-O Ne5: Time to begin mobilising, I plan to exploit the half open c file
moves.11. Ng3 Qc7 12. Be2 b5 13. b4: I could have won a pawn here but think it is too early to exchange a bishop for a knight
moves.13... Be7: this C file is going to cause problems
moves.14. Bb2 Bb7 15. Bf3 Nc4: White is gradually being pushed back
moves.16. Qc1 Rfc8: The pressure on the c file is mounting
moves.17. Re1: Guess I'll win a minor piece here
moves.17... Nxb2 18. Qxb2 Qxc3 19. Qxc3 Rxc3 2: Again maintaining the pressure and forcing white on the back foot
moves.21. Ra2 e5 22. Rd2: I can win a pawn here, but will consolidate first
moves.22... e4 23. Be2 Rxa3: I think this move deserves a !
moves.24. Rb2 Ra1+ 25. Nf1: White is helping black by putting his pieces into more passive squares
moves.25... Ra4 26. Rd4 Ra1 27. g3 Ne8 28. Rd2: Black is much stronger, the rooks are causing chaos
moves.30. Bg4 Rc8xc2: Unless I have missed something white is playing into black's hands. The plan now is to simplify and put pressure on the b4 pawn which will fall eventually and leave black with a won end game
moves.31. Rxc2 Rxc2 32. Bd7 Nd6 33. Bg4 Rb2 34: It is now a matter of time two passed pawns make for a won ending
moves.37. Nh2 a5 38. Bd1 a4 39. Kf1 a3 40. Bb3: This is all over bar the shouting
